quizzes.title: Fundamentals of Computing - Lecture 2: Computer Architecture

questions.question: Who invented the Analytical Engine, which served as a general-purpose programmable computing device?
What was the primary input mechanism for programming the Analytical Engine?
Which device was the world’s first large-scale digital electronic general-purpose computer?
In what year was ENIAC implemented?
Which architecture proposed that programs and data could be stored in memory and changed without rewiring the machine?
Which bus in modern computers is used to transfer data to and from the CPU?
Which microprocessor was released by Intel in 1970 and was the first member of the x86 family?
What is the width of the external data bus in the Intel 8086 microprocessor?
Which registers are general-purpose registers in the Intel 8086 microprocessor?
Which microprocessor was included in the first IBM PC released in 1981?
What was the clock frequency of the Intel 8088 microprocessor in the IBM PC?
Which microprocessor was used in the IBM PC AT released in 1984?
Which microprocessor introduced in 1985 had a 32-bit architecture and backward compatibility with the 8086 and 80286?
Which component of the Intel 80386 microprocessor was responsible for managing memory?
Which year was the first iPhone introduced by Steve Jobs?
What was the size of the screen of the first iPhone?
Which microprocessor powered the first iPhone?
Which company manufactured the ARM11 processor used in the first iPhone?
What operating system did the first iPhone use?
Which feature was introduced with the iPhone’s touch screen?
What type of battery powered the first iPhone?
What is the main advantage of using the von Neumann architecture in computers?
options: Programs and data can be stored in the same memory
questions.answer: Programs and data can be stored in the same memory

questions.question: Which unit in the Intel 80386 microprocessor fetches the code for execution?
Which microprocessor was the first to introduce a 32-bit architecture?
Which architecture allows for the simultaneous execution of audio and video tasks in the first iPhone?

quizzes.title: Fundamentals of Computing - Lecture 3: Data Representation in Computer

questions.question: Which data type refers to numerical information?
What is the term for converting information into digital data that can be manipulated by electronic devices?
What number system is used by computers to process data?
How many bits are in 1 byte?
How much memory is represented by 1 GB?
What is the Binary Coded Decimal (BCD) code used for?
ASCII is a standard code used to represent characters. How many bits are used in the ASCII system?
What is the key difference between ASCII and extended ASCII?
options: ASCII can represent more than 256 characters
Extended ASCII is not used for characters

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Unicode?
options: To provide a unique number for every character
questions.answer: To provide a unique number for every character

questions.question: How many values can be represented by 4 bits in hexadecimal?
In computer architecture, what does the CPU control?
options: The operation of the computer and data processing functions
questions.answer: The operation of the computer and data processing functions

questions.question: What is the role of the ALU (Arithmetic Logic Unit) in a computer?
options: It controls the flow of data
It handles input and output operations

questions.question: Which component in the CPU stores data temporarily and is internal to the CPU?
Which microprocessor is the first member of the x86 family released by Intel?
What does the Program Counter (PC) or Instruction Pointer (IP) hold in the 8086 microprocessor?
options: The address of the next instruction to be executed
The result of the last computation
questions.answer: The address of the next instruction to be executed

questions.question: Which field in the 8086 instruction format specifies the operation to be performed by the CPU?
In the 8086 instruction format, what does the 'D' bit represent?
Which instruction is used to compare two numbers in the 8086 instruction set?
What are the two steps of the instruction cycle?
What is the primary goal of the CISC (Complex Instruction Set Computer) architecture?
options: To complete a task in as few lines of assembly as possible
To use simple instructions executed within one clock cycle
To reduce the amount of memory needed
questions.answer: To complete a task in as few lines of assembly as possible

questions.question: Which architecture uses simple instructions that can be executed within one clock cycle?
What does the instruction 'MOV' do in the 8086 instruction set?
options: Move data from one location to another
questions.answer: Move data from one location to another

questions.question: What is the function of the Control Unit (CU) in the CPU?
options: It coordinates the sequence of data movements into and out of the CPU
It moves data between the computer and its external environment
questions.answer: It coordinates the sequence of data movements into and out of the CPU

questions.question: How are instructions categorized in the 8086 instruction set?

quizzes.title: Fundamentals of Computing - Lecture 4: Digital Logic - 1

questions.question: What is the primary function of conductive materials such as copper in electrical circuits?
options: To inhibit the flow of electricity

questions.question: What is the opposition to the flow of electric current in a conductor called?
What is the relationship between voltage, current, and resistance described by?
A transistor is a semiconductor device used primarily as what?
Which terminal in a transistor collects the current?
Which of the following best describes a logic gate?
options: An electronic circuit with one or more inputs and one output
questions.answer: An electronic circuit with one or more inputs and one output

questions.question: What mathematical model is used to design and simplify digital circuits?
Which type of circuit has outputs that depend only on the current input and has no memory?
Why is simplification of digital logic circuits necessary?
options: To reduce the number of gates and lower cost
questions.answer: To reduce the number of gates and lower cost

questions.question: What is a Karnaugh map (K-map) used for in digital logic?
Which of the following is a rule of K-map simplification?
options: Groups can only contain powers of two
Groups can contain any number of 1s
Only non-adjacent cells can form groups
questions.answer: Groups can only contain powers of two

questions.question: What is the smallest grouping possible in a K-map?
In K-map simplification, groups can wrap around the sides of the map. What does this signify?
options: The values of variables outside the group are not relevant
questions.answer: The values of variables outside the group are not relevant

questions.question: Which of the following variables becomes irrelevant in a three-variable K-map when all other variables cancel out?
What method of simplification is specifically designed for visualizing Boolean expressions in circuit design?
What is the main function of a combinational logic circuit?
options: Process input to produce an output
questions.answer: Process input to produce an output

questions.question: Which circuit element represents a 2-state system in a digital logic circuit?
Why is Boolean algebra used in digital circuits?
In a digital circuit, which logic gate produces an output of 1 only when both inputs are 1?
Which logic gate produces an output of 1 when any one of its inputs is 1?
What is the output of a NAND gate when both inputs are 1?
What is the role of the base terminal in a transistor?
options: It controls the current flowing between the collector and emitter
questions.answer: It controls the current flowing between the collector and emitter

questions.question: What is the objective of combinational circuit simplification?
options: To minimize the number of gates and reduce power consumption
questions.answer: To minimize the number of gates and reduce power consumption

questions.question: In a truth table, what do the columns represent?

quizzes.title: Fundamentals of Computing - Lecture 5: Digital Logic - II

questions.question: What is the sum operation in a half adder?
In a half adder, what operation is used to calculate the carry?
What is the key difference between a half adder and a full adder?
options: A full adder includes a carry input
A full adder includes an OR gate
A half adder uses only one input
A full adder uses only XOR gates
questions.answer: A full adder includes a carry input

questions.question: What does a shifter circuit do?
options: Shifts input bits left or right
questions.answer: Shifts input bits left or right

questions.question: How does a comparator circuit determine if two inputs are equal?
What is the function of a decoder in digital logic?
options: It converts binary information from n inputs to a maximum of 2^n outputs
It shifts bits left or right
questions.answer: It converts binary information from n inputs to a maximum of 2^n outputs

questions.question: In a 3-to-8 binary decoder, how many inputs and outputs are there?
What is the purpose of decoder expansion in combinational circuit design?
options: To combine smaller decoders to form a larger one
To increase the number of inputs
questions.answer: To combine smaller decoders to form a larger one

questions.question: What is the inverse operation of a decoder?
How many OR gates are required to implement a 2^n-to-n encoder?
What is the function of a multiplexer (MUX)?
options: It selects one input from multiple data inputs
It shifts bits left or right
questions.answer: It selects one input from multiple data inputs

questions.question: How many input selection lines are required for a 4-to-1 multiplexer?
Which combinational circuit is used to implement logic functions of a truth table?
What does a programmable logic array (PLA) provide in digital logic design?
options: A quick and easy way to implement Boolean functions
A method to shift bits left or right
A way to compare two inputs
A way to encode binary information
questions.answer: A quick and easy way to implement Boolean functions

questions.question: In a PLA, which gates are arranged in arrays to implement Boolean functions?
What is the main role of an Arithmetic and Logic Unit (ALU)?
options: To perform AND, OR, and sum operations of two input words
To shift bits left or right
questions.answer: To perform AND, OR, and sum operations of two input words

questions.question: In an ALU, which operation is implemented using a full adder circuit?
How are multiple ALU blocks connected together in a CPU that uses n-bit machine words?
options: They are connected in n bit positions
They are connected to a single bit
They are connected to a memory register
questions.answer: They are connected in n bit positions

questions.question: What is the function of carry-in and carry-out signals in an ALU?
options: They cascade adjacent ALU units for the sum operation
questions.answer: They cascade adjacent ALU units for the sum operation

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a combinational circuit?
What type of circuit is a full adder?
What is the output of a comparator when two input bits are equal?
In a multiplexer, what role do selection lines play?
options: They determine which input is sent to the output
questions.answer: They determine which input is sent to the output

questions.question: Which combinational circuit is responsible for encoding binary information?

quizzes.title: Fundamentals of Computing - Lecture 6: Digital Logic - III

questions.question: What is a latch in digital logic?
Which digital logic gates can be used to construct a latch?
What does a clock signal do in digital circuits?
Which flip-flop changes its output only on a clock transition from low to high or high to low?
What are the input signals of a D flip-flop called?
What is the minimum time that a D input must remain constant before a clock transition occurs?
What is a sequential circuit?
options: An interconnection of flip-flops and gates
questions.answer: An interconnection of flip-flops and gates

questions.question: What type of circuit is a D flip-flop?
How can flip-flops be connected to form a shift register?
options: By connecting the Q output of one flip-flop to the D input of the next
questions.answer: By connecting the Q output of one flip-flop to the D input of the next

questions.question: What is a ring counter used for?
What is the purpose of the clock input in a flip-flop?
options: To trigger the transfer of the input to the output
questions.answer: To trigger the transfer of the input to the output

questions.question: In a D flip-flop, when does the state change occur?
options: On the clock’s rising or falling edge
When the circuit is powered off
When the reset signal is applied
questions.answer: On the clock’s rising or falling edge

questions.question: What is the propagation delay in a flip-flop?
options: Time between the clock input and the response in Q
questions.answer: Time between the clock input and the response in Q

questions.question: What operation does a shift register perform?
options: Transfers data bits from one flip-flop to the next on clock cycles
questions.answer: Transfers data bits from one flip-flop to the next on clock cycles

questions.question: What is the primary use of registers in digital circuits?
In the context of registers, what does parallel reading/writing mean?
options: All bits are written or read simultaneously
Bits are shifted one by one
questions.answer: All bits are written or read simultaneously

questions.question: Which circuit element is used to build sequential circuits such as state machines and memory elements?
What type of flip-flop has set and reset inputs to control its state?
What is the purpose of the reset input in a flip-flop?
What is a clocked synchronous sequential circuit?
options: A circuit that uses a clock signal to synchronize its operations
A circuit that shifts data bits
A circuit that compares binary numbers
questions.answer: A circuit that uses a clock signal to synchronize its operations

questions.question: What role do flip-flops play in registers?
How are bits in a register typically written or read?
options: All bits are read or written simultaneously
One bit is read at a time
The clock signal determines the output
questions.answer: All bits are read or written simultaneously

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of using flip-flops in sequential circuits?
What is a shift register with feedback from the Q output called?
Who invented the Analytical Engine, a precursor to modern computers?
What is the primary function of the Arithmetic Logic Unit (ALU)?
In binary representation, how many bits are in a byte?
What is the hexadecimal representation of binary 1110?
Which logic gate gives an output of 1 only when both inputs are 1?
What does the SR latch stand for?
How many input and output lines does a 3-to-8 decoder have?
What operation does a multiplexer perform?
What does a D flip-flop store?
In a sequential circuit, what component stores state information?
What is the purpose of clocking in digital circuits?
What is the main function of a latch in digital logic?
In a ring counter, what happens to the output?
options: It is fed back to the input
questions.answer: It is fed back to the input

questions.question: What does the term 'setup time' refer to in flip-flops?
options: The time before a clock transition during which input must be stable
The time after a clock transition during which input must be stable
The time required to reset the circuit
The time required for data to propagate
questions.answer: The time before a clock transition during which input must be stable

questions.question: What is the result of a shift operation in a shift register?
options: Data is shifted left or right
questions.answer: Data is shifted left or right

questions.question: What is the binary equivalent of the hexadecimal number 'A'?
What is the main difference between a half adder and a full adder?
options: A full adder has a carry input
A full adder uses only AND gates
A full adder compares two inputs
questions.answer: A full adder has a carry input

questions.question: Which gate is used to check if two binary inputs are equal?
What does a decoder do?
In an edge-triggered flip-flop, when does the output state change?
options: At the clock's rising or falling edge
At the end of a clock cycle
questions.answer: At the clock's rising or falling edge

questions.question: What does the hold time in a flip-flop represent?
options: The minimum time that the input must remain unchanged after the clock transition
The time between input and output
The time to reset the flip-flop
The time to load data into memory
questions.answer: The minimum time that the input must remain unchanged after the clock transition

questions.question: How does a comparator circuit work?
options: It compares two inputs and produces a result based on equality
It shifts bits left or right
questions.answer: It compares two inputs and produces a result based on equality

questions.question: Which of the following is an application of a shift register?
What is the primary function of a multiplexer in digital circuits?
options: To select one of several inputs to be sent to the output
questions.answer: To select one of several inputs to be sent to the output

questions.question: What type of signal is used to maintain timing in digital circuits?
Which of the following circuits is considered combinational?
What role does a clock play in sequential circuits?
Which circuit is used to store a single bit of data?
What is the purpose of an SR flip-flop?
options: To store a single bit and provide set/reset control
questions.answer: To store a single bit and provide set/reset control

questions.question: What is the size of an int data type in Java?
Which component in a CPU performs logical and arithmetic operations?
In digital logic, what does the AND gate output when both inputs are 1?
What is the function of a half adder?
options: To add two binary digits and output sum and carry
questions.answer: To add two binary digits and output sum and carry

questions.question: Which device in a digital circuit stores a single bit of data?
What is the function of a decoder in digital logic?
options: To convert binary inputs into a maximum of 2^n unique outputs
questions.answer: To convert binary inputs into a maximum of 2^n unique outputs

questions.question: What does a D flip-flop do?
options: It transfers the D input to the output on the clock edge
It stores two bits of data
questions.answer: It transfers the D input to the output on the clock edge

questions.question: What is the purpose of a clock in sequential circuits?
What happens during the setup time of a flip-flop?
options: The input must remain stable before the clock transition
The input changes after the clock transition
questions.answer: The input must remain stable before the clock transition

questions.question: What type of circuit is used for serial-to-parallel data conversion?
What is the function of a ring counter?
options: It transfers data bits in a circular manner
It stores two bits of data
questions.answer: It transfers data bits in a circular manner

questions.question: In a sequential circuit, what is the function of flip-flops?
Which gate outputs 1 when all inputs are 0?
What is the output of an XOR gate when both inputs are the same?
What is a sequential circuit composed of?
